text.tspan: Many years ago Bill Gates quit college to start his own company.
By now he has built that company into the largest of its kind.
Must / Will / Shall / Can / May + Verb
The weatherman says it will rain tomorrow.
He said he would have his own way.
If I were you, I would accept the offer.
I wish i had the money.
It is time that you started living on your own.
If the driver had been more careful,
the accident could have been prevented.
I wish I had gone abroad when I graduated.
If he were to graduate on schedule, you could call me blind.
If I should win the lottery, I would buy up the company.
I might have my own grandchildren now.
It is necessary / important / essential that the letter be sent out before noon.
The coach suggests that the player stay at school.
God bless you ! / Long live the King!
